 Documentary maker admits to killing lover | News Story on 365gay.com
 
 
 
 Award-winning documentary maker Ray Gosling announced on the BBC he suffocated a former lover. The announcement came as a shock to both BBC staff and viewers.
 Send / Share
 Add Comment
 "I killed someone once ... He was a young chap, he'd been my lover and he got AIDS," said Gosling, 70, on Tuesday's broadcast of BBC East Midlands' Inside Out.
 
 news-ray-gosling-top
 
 Does he have any regrets? "None whatsoever, I did the right thing," he said.
 
 A spokeswoman for the local police said they were not aware of the situation until Tuesday morning's broadcast. BBC officials said they would cooperate with an investigation.
 
 While walking though a graveyard, he recounted the incident on the morning BBC show.
 
 "In a hospital one hot afternoon, the doctor said, 'There's nothing we can do,' and he was in terrible, terrible pain. I said to the doctor, 'Leave me just for a bit,' and he went away. I picked up the pillow and smothered him until he was dead. The doctor came back and I said, 'He's gone.' Nothing more was ever said."
 
 Gosling said his story illustrates the need for changing assisted suicide laws. In England, aiding another person commit suicide is illegal and punishable with up to 14 years in jail.
